result.execSummary:
The defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
Authorized if defendant successfully completes probation.
Defendant is to follow all outpatient treatment plans/recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - if defendant does not comply with all conditions of probation - the stay will be lifted and the jail time imposed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karley Kathleen Bradley

defendant.name: Bradley, Karley Kathleen
defendant.address: 203 East Glen Street, Apt. #3, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: from DOC to court re: credit - court denies

10:17 AM Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Lynch and defendant have received revocation paperwork, no errors or inaccuracies. State makes argument prior to recommendation - credit of 269 days (stipulated) - recommends 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5  years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES. Discussion on credit and credit stipulated by both parties is 212. Lynch makes argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 1 year straight jail - requesting good time and huber - requesting programming. Bradley makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 3 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - credit for 212 days, eligible for programming, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 30, 2019 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 45 days jail as a condition of probation without huber
30 days jail added as a condition of probation without Huber

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF18, 16CF20 & 16CF89. Voorhees there is a resolution on 16CF18 & 16CF20 has PLQ and provides it to the court. State recites agreement, Count 1 in 16CF18 would be amend to 961.41(3g)(am) defendant would enter a guilty plea, 16CF20 & 16CF89 would be DRI. With hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of 90 days conditional time in FC jail (Vorhees free to argue), $100 plus costs, AODA and follow through, reimburse drug task force $300, absolute sobriety, no possession, FT emp/schol, 200 hours community service, one self help meeting per week. Voorhees and Bradley agree. Court amends count #1 to 961.41(3g) Class I Felony of Manufacture/Deliver Narcotics, reads new penalty, DE pleads G to count #1. Court dismisses but reads in 16CF20 & 16CF89. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constiutional rights and right to trial. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State makes final argument and asks for Bradley to be eligible for expunction. Voorhees provides court with verification of treatment participation, makes final argument, asks that the court does impose jail asks for huber for child care be allowed and asks for expunction of cases. Court advises cases that are dimissed cannot be expunged. State intended for dismissed cases to also be expunged. Voorhees due to cases being resolved globaly feels that all cases could be expunged. Court reads statue in regards to expunction. Advises parties to research. Off record, 3:28 for short recess. Called back on the record, 3:42 PM. Has discussed with his client and would like to proceed with sentence today and any stipulated motions could be filed at a later date. Court refers to Supreme Court Rule on expunction. Voorhees makes final statement. Bradley makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts statements and sentences to the following: 16CF18 - Count #1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $100 fine plus costs, AODA and follow through with any recommendations, follow all outpatient recommendations, must attend one AA/NA meeting per week, reimburse Forest County Drug Task Force costs of $300, no consumption or possession of alcohol, FT employment/schooling, 200 hours of community service, imposes 90 days in FC jail, stayed, must comply with all conditions of probation. One day jail credit, only if revoked. Apply bond posted to fine/costs, remainder to be paid through probation. Court will authorize expunction once all conditions of probation are completed and no violations through term of probation. DNA with expunction rights. Voting/firearm rights given. Right to appeal.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:11 PM. Called 16CF18 & 16CF20. State here for PH. Voorhees would like to hear them seperatly. 16CF20 - State calls Steven Ashbeck, 12:12 PM, State directs. Voorhees asks for sequesteration of all witness, State indicates only witness on both cases. Identification of witness, 12:20 PM. Voorhees cross examines, 12:20 PM. State - objection - sustained, 12:22 PM. State - objection - sustained - over ruled, 12:23 PM. State - re-direct, 12:28 PM. Voorhees objections - speculation - sustained, 12:31 PM. Court - finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State - files INFO, mirrors. Voorhees asks for motion that case be dismissed. Court denies motion to dismiss. State moves to enter exhibit #1 into case, no objections. Court accepts exhibit #1. Voorhees has information and waives further reading, proceed to ARGN. Voorhees enters NG pleas to all counts, indicates has not received all discovery and asks for extension of time. State does not object. 14 days from reciept of discovery to allow filing of motions. Court will adjourn until 1:30 PM to here the PH on 16CF18, Adjourned, 12:36 PM. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:42 PM. 16CF18 - State - has made offer through Voorhees, have an agreement amending to misd. charges, providing she does not reoffend and with that agreement will waive PH. Court goes over waiver of PH form, finds the defendant is freely and voluntairly waiving her right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State has filed INFO, mirrors. Voorhees has copy and waives further reading, proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
From attorney, requesting adjournment for PH. Approved by Judge.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:10 PM. Voorhees and Bradley have both complaints, waives reading of them, requests PH on both matters, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond on both cases, sets both matters for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Marcus Morris except for issues related to their child in common.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:05 AM. Also called 16CF20. Bradley has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bradley understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court instructs defendant to contact SPD today. Court believes the defendant is eligible for SPD. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - asks for clarification of the defendant's address. Bradley - states that the address stated by the State is her mom's address, states her address is 203 East Glen Street, Apt. #3, Crandon, WI. Defendant made statement in regards to where she could live if she gets a signature bond. State - bond - $500 cash bond on each case and no contact with co-defendant in each file. Court - bond - $250.00 cash on each case, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Marcus Morris. Court can re-address bond if the defendant can't post the money.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
